On 6 December 2024, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, two men opened fire from a vehicle (drive-by) and shot a truck driver several times in Colonia Francisco Villa. The man was injured as a result. 1 injury.

source: El Siglo de Durango; Noroeste; Riodoce
notes: On 8 December 2024, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, four people were kidnapped by unidentified armed individuals in Colonia Benito Juarez. Also, two brothers were also kidnapped in the same Colonia. This event is likely related to the ongoing war between factions of the Sinaloa Cartel. The six victim's whereabouts are unknown.
On 9 December 2024, in Coquimatlan, Colima, armed men shot at a municipal police officer (off-duty) in Colonia Hacienda Buenos Aires and then fled the scene. The victim died the next day. 1 fatality.

Around 9 December 2024 (as reported), in Lerma de Villada, Mexico, a man was killed and his body was found tied, beaten and with bullet wounds on the Toluca-Naucalpan highway near Colonia Agricola Analco. 1 fatality.

source: El Siglo de Durango; Noroeste; Riodoce
notes: On 8 December 2024, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, a man was kidnapped by unknown individuals in the colonia Frencisco Villa. He was held, beaten up and handcuffed. He was later left injured.

On 7 December 2024, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, armed individuals on a motorcycle shot and killed in a drive-by a man around Parque Martiniano Carvajal. Also in Mazatlan, two armed individuals on a motorcycle shot and injured a man in fraccionamiento Infonavit Playas (drive-by). 1 fatality.

Around 1 October 2024 (month of), in La Paz, Baja California, members of the Group of Tactical Operations of the state police and navy officers hit and injured an unspecified number of arrested drug dealers during an operation in Colonia Valle del Mezquite. Unspecified number of injured.
Around 8 October 2024 (as reported), in Encarnacion de Diaz, Jalisco, unidentified gangs clashed. Two men died and another was injured. 2 fatalities, 1 injured.

Around 8 October 2024 (as reported), in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, two men abducted three people of Colombian nationality (a man, a woman, and a child), got them on a bus, and forced the drivers to drive towards Monterrey. Civil Force officers arrested the men and released the victims on Monterrey-Nuevo Laredo road, in the municipality of Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo Leon.

On 2 November 2024, in Zapopan, Jalisco, unidentified individuals abducted a state police officer who was visiting friends in Paseos del Sol (likely off-duty). According to a video published on social media, the perpetrators partially undressed him and questioned him. The victim was released on 6 November 2024.

Around 1 December 2024 (month of), in Ciudad Constitucion, Baja California Sur, members of the Group of Tactical Operations of the state police and navy officers hit and injured an unspecified number of arrested drug dealers during an operation in Los Pinos. Unspecified number of injured.

On 19 September 2024, in La Estanzuela, Jalisco, members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) opened fire at elements of the National Guard on patrol who repelled the aggression. Officers arrested ten people and released two men who were kidnapped. One person was found dead at the site (no information on the circumstances). Officers seized several vehicles, weapons, magazines and drugs. There were no casualties.

source: 24 Horas (Mexico); El Proceso; Imagen del Golfo; La Verdad; Milenio; Quadratin Oaxaca
notes: On 4 October 2024, in Maria Lombardo de Caso, Oaxaca, at least two men abducted a woman Mixe Indigenous activist and lawyer and her husband. The woman had denounced state and federal police officers who shared intimate images of Indigenous women in chats. An arrest operation against the suspected perpetrators led to an armed clash near Palomares around 29 January 2025 (coded separately). Another woman suspect was arrested in the municipality of Santiago Yaveo around 3 February 2025. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

Around 24 September 2024 (as reported), in the municipality of Mineral de la Reforma, Hidalgo, a woman was killed and her body was found tied and with her mouth covered in tape between El Saucillo and La Providencia. 1 fatality.

On 3 October 2024, in Canada del Agua, Michoacan de Ocampo, armed individuals opened fire at officers of the National Guard who repelled the aggression. One man was hit by a stray bullet and died as a result. 1 fatality.

On 13 November 2024, in San Francisco Tlalcilalcalpan, Mexico, two armed individuals on a motorcycle chased a man traveling in his vehicle who got out of his car and attempted to flee. The armed men continued to chase him and shot and killed him. 1 fatality.
Around 7 December 2024 (as reported), in Indaparapeo, Michoacan, a person was killed and the body was found dismembered inside bags on the Naranjos-Canada de Agua Blanca road. 1 fatality.

source: El Siglo de Durango; Zona Franca
notes: On 8 October 2024, in Celaya, Guanajuato, according to witnesses, a group of armed men entered a mechanic workshop on Norte 9 street, in Ciudad Industrial, and shot and killed four men, among whom there were employees. 4 fatalities.

On 14 October 2024, in Jerez de Garcia Salinas, Zacatecas, members of the CJNG aboard several vehicles placed a narco banner at the front of the municipal presidency and when they left, they threw fragmentation grenades towards the municipal presidency which injured five people. Another version is that the CJNG threw the grenades and shot directly at taxi drivers at the municipal presidency leading to 5 injuries. Three taxis were damaged. 5 injuries.

source: El Sol de Acapulco; El Universal (Mexico); Milenio
notes: On 12 November 2024, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, a man was shot and killed by unidentified armed individuals behind the Baltazar R. Leyva Mancilla Market in Chilpancingo in Colonia Elias Naime Nemer. One version is that the victim was a worker from the Municipal Government Department and another version indicated that he was a worker of the municipal market. 1 fatality.

On 15 November 2024, in Zinapecuaro de Figueroa, Michoacan de Ocampo, rival criminal groups engaged in an armed clash near the municipal palace. During the clash the groups fired at the facade of the Manipal palace and set fire to a vehicle parked outside the palace. Also, armed men threw tire punctures close to the municipal presidency to avoid their rivals from catching up with them after an armed clash. There were no casualties.

On 16 September 2024, in Tizayuca, Hidalgo, three men on two motorbikes shot and injured a former military officer in front of his house in Fraccionamiento San Angel (drive-by). According to witnesses, the victim had previously held an argument with the perpetrators.
On 14 September 2024, in Patzcuaro, Michoacan, there was an armed clash between the state police and armed men in Colonia Juventino Rosas. Two police officers were injured.

Around 24 September 2024 (as reported), in San Francisco Coacalco, Mexico, a person was killed and the body was found wrapped in plastic bags in an abandoned car in Colonia Bosques del Valle. 1 fatality.
Around 25 September 2024 (as reported), in Ecatepec de Morelos, Mexico, a man was killed and his remains were found inside a suitcase in Colonia Santo Tomas Chiconautla. 1 fatality.

On 27 September 2024, in Nopala, Hidalgo, army and state police officers clashed with an armed group of huachicoleros (fuel thieves) during an operations against theft of fuel in Dentho. Two huachicoleros were killed, three arrested, and two officers injured. 2 fatalities.

Around 29 September 2024 (as reported), in Nopala de Villagran, Hidalgo, army and National Guard officers clashed with armed individuals. Five people were injured (four officers and an armed individual). The officers seized drugs and fuel.
Around 4 October 2024 (as reported), in Ecatepec de Morelos, Mexico, a man was killed and his body was found in Colonia Mesa de Leones. A message was found next to the body. 1 fatality.
Around 10 October 2024 (as reported), in Tizayuca, Hidalgo, a woman was killed and her body was found with signs of torture in colonia San Juan Huicalco. 1 fatality.

Around 5 October 2024 (as reported), in Ecatepec de Morelos, Mexico, a man was killed and his body was found with gunshot wounds to his body and with a message next to him in Colonia Mesa de Leones. 1 fatality.

Around 8 October 2024 (as reported), in Ecatepec de Morelos, Mexico, a man was killed and his body was found with a cut on the throat and inside a plastic bag under a trailer on Rio de los Remedios avenue, in the junction with General Cristobal Solano street, in Colonia Granjas Valle de Guadalupe. 1 fatality.

Around 9 October 2024 (as reported), in the municipality of Ecatepec de Morelos, Mexico, two people (one of them a man) were killed and their bodies were found inside plastic bags on Mexico-Pachuca road. 2 fatalities.

Around 9 October 2024 (as reported), in Ecatepec de Morelos, Mexico, a man was killed and his body was found with knife wounds and the hands tied on Puerto Morazan street, near Las Torres avenue, in Colonia Tierra Blanca. 1 fatality.

On 8 October 2024, in San Francisco Tlaloc, Puebla, army officers and suspected armed huachicoleros (fuel thieves) clashed when the latter shot at the officers that were conducting a routine surveillance operation. Two army officers were injured.
Around 21 October 2024 (as reported), in Ecatepec de Morelos, Mexico, a person was killed and the body was found dismembered and wrapped in bags on the Lecheria-Texcoco road. 1 fatality.

Around 26 October 2024 (as reported), in Licenciado Benito Juarez, Sinaloa, two men were killed and their bodies were found shot to death with signs of torture and covered in a tarp in Villa Juarez. 2 fatalities.
On 28 October 2024, in Mojolo, Sinaloa, armed individuals opened fire at ministerial federal police officers. There were no casualties.

On 4 November 2024, in Tres Palos, Guerrero, unknown armed individuals shot and killed a family inside their home. Four men, two women and a minor were found inside the home. Three vehicles were set on fire. 7 fatalities.

On 14 November 2024, in San Francisco Coacalco, Mexico, two men arrived at a diner and shot at a couple inside in Colonia Colina San Rafael. The man died as a result and the woman was injured. 1 fatality, 1 injury.

source: Diario Via Libre; El Norte; Milenio; News Hidalgo
notes: On 17 November 2024, in Tizayuca, Hidalgo, according to witnesses, armed individuals shot and killed a man while driving. His son was also injured but died later at the hospital. 2 fatalities.

On 18 November 2024, in San Francisco Coacalco, Mexico, two armed individuals on a motorcycle shot and killed a man and a woman in Colonia Villa de las Flores and then fled the scene (drive-by). 2 fatalities.

Around 22 November 2024 (as reported), in San Miguel Xaltepec, Puebla, a man was attacked and he was found alive tied to a pole, wrapped in plastic, with signs of torture, and a cardboard with a threatening message written on it, in front of a health center. 1 injured.
Around 28 November 2024 (as reported), in Ecatepec de Morelos, Mexico, a man was killed and his body was found with his hands tied up in Colonia Santo Tomas Chiconautla. 1 fatality.

On 29 November 2024, in Mojolo, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between military officers and a criminal group linked to Los Chapitos gang and led by son the of Alfredo Beltran Leyva, 'El Mochomo'. Two criminal member was arrested, after a confrontation with elements of the Navy (SEMAR) and National Defense (DEFENSA). Some reports suggest that the leader of the gang was arrested, while the security forces have not confirmed this information. According to local sources, several people were killed, including bodyguards of the criminal member, but it is unknown the exact number of fatalities. The criminal member was also injured. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

Around 2 December 2024 (as reported), in El Metlapil, Guerrero, a body without head was found with his hands and feet tied up. The victim's head was found in El Treinta (La Venta) (coded separately). 0 fatalities coded here.

On 4 December 2024, in Cuauhtemoc, Colima, armed individuals in a vehicle shot and killed a man on an old road (drive-by). It is suspected that the victim is a municipal police officer, although authorities have not confirmed the information. 1 fatality.

On 8 December 2024, in Tizayuca, Hidalgo, at least five individuals abducted the Director of Family Medicine of the Social Security Institute and demanded his family to pay a ransom and hand over two vehicles for his release. Ministerial police officers arrested five suspects around 12 December 2024 in Huetamo, Michoacan de Ocampo. It is unknown whether the victim was located.

On 5 December 2024, in Ecatepec de Morelos, Mexico, there was a clash between the state police and municipal police officers after two state police were arrested and accuse to extortion. The clash started after the colleagues of the detained who were state police officers tried to released them. The Ministerial police also intervened and held the detainees.

Around 8 October 2024 (as reported), in Ecatepec de Morelos, Mexico, a person was killed and the body was found with stab wounds and the hands tied on a field near La Preciosa street, in Colonia Pirules de Ballisco. 1 fatality.

On 25 October 2024, in Cancun, Quintana Roo, armed men abducted and on the same day killed a member of the Andres Quintana Roo Taxi Union and his body was found next to Cancun-Merida road. Nine men were arrested, including the union's secretary for suspectedly having ordered the killing. A search in the union's premises on 6 November 2024 led to the seizure of drugs and the location of a torture room. 1 fatality.

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero
notes: Around 15 October 2024 (as reported), in Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero, a man was killed and his body was found wrapped in a sheet and tied in Colonia San Felipe de Jesus. 1 fatality.

On 24 October 2024, in Huamuxtitlan, Guerrero, a group of several armed men intercepted the former Morena mayor, kidnapped him and killed his driver. The former mayor was found dead the same day. 2 fatalities.

source: Diario de Morelos; El Norte; La Jornada; La Prensa de Monclova; La Silla Rota; Milenio
notes: On 24 October 2024, in Tecpan de Galeana, Guerrero, members of Guerrero New Generation aboard at least 20 trucks engaged in an armed clash with Los Granados gang on a road that leads to El Moreno. Municipal police officers on duty were involved in the attack resulting in the death of two municipal police officers. The military also came under attack and received support from elements of the National Guard. Three military officers were injured as a result. 17 armed individuals died. It is believed that one of the rival gangs have links with the CJNG. Over 100 gang members had entered the municipality the same day and were being searched by military and police officers. Police and military seized 16 vehicles, weapons, cartridges and explosive devices. 11 armed individuals were arrested. 19 fatalities.
Around 26 October 2024 (as reported), in Amozoc de Mota, Puebla, two men were killed and their bodies were found dismembered inside plastic bags in Colonia San Jose Las Flores. 2 fatalities.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 16 October 2024, in Cosamaloapan, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, according to witnesses, armed men on a vehicle shot at a vehicle, killing a man and injuring his underage daughter (drive-by) on Adolfo Ruiz Cortines y Morelos street. An alternative version indicates that his daughter remained uninjured. The man was a former municipal police officer. 1 fatality.

On 15 October 2024, in Celaya, Guanajuato, for a second consecutive day, armed men entered the vehicle verification center and opened fire at employees, killing two people and injuring one. 2 fatalities, 1 injury.

On 15 October 2024, in Irapuato, Guanajuato, several unknown armed men opened fire and killed three men inside a bar in Colonia Santa Julia. One of the men was an 18 year old waiter who was shot in the head. 3 fatalities.

On 19 October 2024, in Irapuato, Guanajuato, unidentified men entered a house in the intersection of Santander and Matogrosso streets, in Colonia Las Americas, and attempted to abduct a man. His mother, who was in the house, hit the men to try to prevent the abduction. The men then shot and killed the man and the woman. The perpetrators fled aboard two vans. 2 fatalities.

Around 30 October 2024 (as reported), in Tetitlan, Guerrero, military, National Guard, state police, and ministerial federal police officers clashed with members of the GNG. The officers arrested five individuals. Casualties unknown.

On 20 October 2024, in Tonala, Jalisco, unidentified individuals shot and killed a man, and his body was found hours later wrapped in plastic in the intersection of Trincheras and Vicente Guerrero streets, in Colonia Altamira. 1 fatality.
On 16 October 2024, in Zapopan, Jalisco, several armed individuals arrived at a family party in Colonia Santa Margarita and opened fire at a man who died as a result. 1 fatality.

On 13 October 2024, in Chimalhuacan, Puebla, armed men entered a grocery store and opened fire at customers inside and outside the grocery store. One man threw a bottle at the armed men in an attempt to prevent the attack. Two men died as a result and one person was injured. Four children, who were inside the store were not injured. 2 fatalities.

Around 28 October 2024 (as reported), in the municipality of Santa Maria Coronango, Puebla, two people were killed and their bodies were found with signs of torture on Mexico-Puebla highway. Different versions indicate that the victims are a man and a woman or two men. 2 fatalities.

On 16 October 2024, in Guadalupe, Zacatecas, officers of the military and municipal police were carrying out an arrest when they were shot at by armed individuals and repelled the aggression in Colonia Las Americas. Three men were arrested, including one minor, accused of being members of the CDN. Police officers seized weapons, drugs and homemade explosives.

On 18 October 2024, in the municipality of Cienega de Flores, Nuevo Leon, state police officers and unidentified gang members clashed on Cienagade Flores-Salinas Victoria road, by Colonia Real del Sol. Three armed individuals died and five officers were injured. 3 fatalities, 5 injured.

On 18 October 2024, in Tepeojuma, Puebla, according to witnesses, unidentified individuals shot at three members of a family who were refueling at a Pemex gas station, killing two (a man and his underage son) and injuring a woman (their wife and mother). An employee of the station was collaterally injured. The attack was suspectedly linked to drug deals and targeted the two dead men, who were members of a gang led by someone known as 'El Medina'. 2 fatalities, 2 injured.

source: El Proceso; La Voz de Michoacan
notes: Around 19 October 2024 (as reported), in the bordering area between Michoacan and Colima (coded to Coahuayana de Hidalgo), Michoacan de Ocampo, a landmine exploded and injured four members of the Coahuayana de Hidalgo Communal Militia (Mexico) that travelled in a van. Other members of the militia later found three other mines in the area.

Around 23 October 2024 (as reported), in Canton San Luis, Chiapas, a person was killed and the human remains were found dismembered inside plastic bags including one bag with the limbs and legs and the other bag with the rest of the body. 1 fatality.

On 14 October 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Coyoacan, several people attacked officers of the State Secretariat of Citizen Security (SSC) while they were conducting security patrols and observed two people exchanging money and bags in Colonia Emiliano Zapata. When officers attempted to arrest both people as suspected drug dealers, three other individuals arrived to prevent the arrest, beating the officers. Police officers ended up arresting five people and seizing drugs.

On 17 October 2024, in the municipality of Progreso, Coahuila de Zaragoza, unidentified individuals shot at officers of the State Attorney General's office, the Agency of Criminal Investigations (AIC) and the Action and Reaction Police (PAR). The officers repelled the attack, killed three men and seized three fireweapons. 3 fatalities.

On 14 September 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Alvaro Obregon, according to witnesses, a man and a woman shot and killed a man on Privada del Rodeio street, in Colonia El Rodeo. The perpetrators were arrested and the authorities seized drugs. 1 fatality.
On 8 October 2024, in Carmen, Nuevo Leon, three armed men shot and killed a man in Colonia Hacienda El Jaral. The three perpetrators were arrested around March 2025. 1 fatality.

On 21 October 2024, in Manzanillo, Colima, armed men in a vehicle shot and killed a woman in a drive-by shooting on Avenida Elias Zamora Verduzco. The woman was an employee of the Attorney General's Office (FGR). 1 fatality.
On 12 October 2024, in Cuajinicuilapa, Guerrero, armed men in a vehicle shot and killed (drive-by) two men at a taxi station. One of the victims was a taxi union leader and his brother. 2 fatalities.
On 12 October 2024, in Ciudad Apodaca, Nuevo Leon, unidentified armed men shot and injured a ministerial police officer in colonia Pueblo Nuevo.

On 10 October 2024, in San Luis Rio Colorado, Sonora, there was an armed clash between criminal groups in colonia Comercial. Two men were kidnapped. They were killed and the same day their bodies were found burned inside a vehicle in Colonia Burocrata. Later, six people were arrested. 2 fatalities.

On 14 October 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, unidentified individuals who arrived in a van shot at people at Las Cruces taxi stand, killing two men (including a taxi driver) and injuring four people. Also in Acapulco, according to witnesses, unidentified individuals shot and killed a taxi driver who had just left his house in El Cuetero. 3 fatalities, 4 injured.

On 28 October 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, two individuals on a motorcycle shot and killed a woman who was driving on Alta Quebradora street, in Ciudad Renacimiento (drive-by). The victim was a preschool teacher at Las Casitas El Quemado kindergarten. 1 fatality.
On 11 October 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, according to witnesses, two armed men on a motorcycle shot and injured (drive-by) a man and his son in fraccionamiento Hornos. 2 injured.

Around 11 October 2024 (as reported), in Cuajinicuilapa, Guerrero, a man was killed and beheaded. The body and the head were thrown. Relatives of the victim pick up the body and take it away. 1 fatality.

On 10 October 2024, between General Bravo and Tamaulipas state, Nuevo Leon, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and the state police that started in Tamaulipas and ended in General Bravo. Three armed men were killed. 3 fatalities.
Around 10 October 2024 (as reported), in Tepexco, Puebla, a man was killed and the body was found with signs of torture and gunshot wounds on the Izucar de Matamoros - Cuautla. 1 fatality.

On 18 November 2024, in Ciudad Obregon, Sonora, five men and a boy who were members of an unspecified gang abducted a man near 300 street and International Road and took him to a house on Rio Panuco street, in Colonia Francisco Villa, Navojoa, where they subjected him to physical and psychological violence (methods unknown). Military officers and agents of the Federal Attorney General's office arrested the perpetrators and released the victim on 3 March 2025. 1 injured.

Around 15 September 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a man was killed and the body was found with his hands tied up, signs of torture and a tourniquet in Fraccionamiento Farallon. 1 fatality.
On 17 September 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, armed individuals shot at a taxi on Mexico-Acapulco federal road, direction Cima-Cruces, injuring the driver. The passengers were not injured.
Around 18 September 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a teenager was killed and his body was found with his hands tied to his back in Colonia Postal. 1 fatality.

On 19 September 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, two armed men in a car opened fire at municipal police officers in the center of the city leading to a chase. The armed men fled the scene after abandoning the car. One civilian was killed, one police officer was injured and two vehicles were damaged in the attack. 1 fatality, 1 injury.

Around 19 September 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a man was killed and his dismembered body was found inside three plastic bags with signs of torture in Colonia Progreso. 1 fatality.

Around 20 September 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a man was killed and his body was found with signs of torture in La Poza. The man was identified as a missing person since 8 September. 1 fatality.

Around 21 September 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a man was killed and the body was found with a tourniquet wrapped in a tarp on the Mexico- Acapulco road around Colonia Benito Juarez and Colonia Libertad. 1 fatality.
Around 22 September 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a man was killed and the body was found with a tourniquet inside a vehicle around Distrito de Galeana. 1 fatality.
Around 29 September 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a person was killed and their remains were found inside plastic bags on bulevar Vicente Guerrero. 1 fatality.

Around 1 October 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a person was killed and the human remains were found inside black plastic bags inside a metal tub on Costera Miguel Aleman Avenue in Fraccionamiento Magallanes. 1 fatality.

On 30 September 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, armed individuals in a vehicle shot and killed a taxi driver in a drive-by on the Mexico-Acapulco highway around Colonia 20 de noviembre. 1 fatality.

Around 1 October 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a man was killed and the body was found with his hands and feet tied up with a tourniquet around his neck in Colonia Morelos. 1 fatality.

Around 3 October 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, four men were killed and two bodies were found dismembered at an intersection of Colonia San Miguel in the direction of El Pitayo and two more on the federal highway. The two dismembered men were removed by family members, according to witnesses. Also in Acapulco, a man was killed and his body was found with a torniquet around his neck, his hands and feet tied and with signs of torture in Colonia El Progreso. 5 fatalities.

Around 30 September 2024 (between 30 September - 3 October), in San Martin Texmelucan de Labastida, Puebla, a man was killed and his decapitated body was found inside a car outside a Walmart store. An unspecified threatening message was found next to the body. The victim was a business man who had been abducted by members of La Barredora Gang on 30 September 2024, and his body was found on 3 October 2024. A video on social media showed the victim alive, semi-naked and with signs of torture. In the video, the victim tells people involved in 'huachicoleo' (fuel theft), drug dealing and extortion to 'stay away from San Martin'. 1 fatality.

Around 4 October 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, two men were killed and their bodies were found with a torniquet around their necks, their hands tied and with signs of torture in Colonia Bellavista. 2 fatalities.

On 28 September 2024, in Pueblo Nuevo, Sinaloa, rival armed groups clashed on the highway known as 'Maxipista Culiacan-Mazatla'. Several other related clashes were recorded on the same day in other communities along this road (coded separately). Three bodies were found in Pueblo Nuevo while a the body of a fourth man was found along the Maxipista Culiacan - Mazatlan who suspectedly was involved in these clashes. This event is likely related to the ongoing fight between factions of the Sinaloa Cartel that started on 9 September (coded separately). 4 fatalities.

Around 4 October 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a person was killed and the human remains were abandoned by several armed individuals inside three bags in Colonia La Sabana. 1 fatality.

Around 7 October 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a person was killed and the body was found with signs of torture and wrapped in sheets in Colonia Ciudad Renacimiento. 1 fatality.

Around 8 October 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a man was killed and his body was thrown from a vehicle and found with signs of torture and the hands tied between 20 de Noviembre and Francisco Gonzalez Bocanegra streets, in Colonia Libertad. 1 fatality.
On 8 October 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, according to witnesses, armed men shot and killed a woman in an area known as 'Derrumbe', in Calzada Pie de la Cuesta, in the port. 1 fatality.

On 9 October 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, two armed individuals on a motorbike shot at people at a taxi stop located between Constituyentes avenue and 17 de Septiembre street, in Colonia Centro, injuring a taxi driver and a woman (drive-by).
On 15 October 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, armed individuals chased a person and opened fire from a moving motorcycle in Colonia Las Parotas killing the victim. 1 fatality.

Around 15 October 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, one person was killed and the human remains were found inside plastic bags inside a drum in Ciudad Renacimiento. A message was found next to the remains. 1 fatality.

Around 16 October 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, two people were killed and their human remains were found inside a vehicle that was set on fire in Colonia Libertadores. 2 fatalities.

On 19 October 2024, in Uruapilla, Michoacan de Ocampo, an armed group shot and killed an off-duty state police officer who was driving on Morelia-Patzcuaro road. The victim was the chief of the escort of the municipal president of Huiramba, Michoacan. 1 fatality.

On 21 October 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, there was an armed clash between the state police and armed individuals in Colonia Emiliano Zapata. One officer was killed and another two people were arrested. 1 fatality.

On 19 October 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, two armed individuals on a car shot and killed a man on Velazquez de Leon street, in an area known as 'Tamarindo', in Colonia Centro (drive-by). 1 fatality.

Around 21 October 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a man was killed and his body was found with a tourniquet around his neck, tied up hands and feet, and with visible signs of torture in Colonia La Libertad. 1 fatality.

Around 22 October 2024 (as reported), in Jilotepec de Molina Enriquez, Mexico, a man was killed and his body was found with a shot to his head, tied, and with a message next to the body in San Pablo Huantepec. 1 fatality.
On 27 October 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, unknown armed individuals shot and killed a traffic municipal police officer when he arrived at his home in Colonia Postal. 1 fatality.

Around 27 October 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, two men were killed and their bodies were found with signs of torture, tied up and with a tourniquet inside a trunk in Colonia Juan R. Escudero. 2 fatalities.

Around 29 October 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, the amputated hand of a man was found on 16 de Septiembre street, in front of a kids playground, in Colonia La Fabrica. notes: On 21 October 2024, in Alcoyonqui, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between at least 30 armed individuals and the military forces. During the armed clash, a gang leader from the Sinaloa Cartel, belonging to Los Mayitos gang, and 20 other gang members were arrested. An alternative version indicates that rival armed groups had clashed before the army officers arrived at the scene and that, once they arrived, the military agreed not to arrest the cartel's leader in exchange for a million dollars. The officers would have subsequently broken the agreement, stolen the money, and clashed with the members of the cartel. This version is supported by a message on a blanket that was hung in Culiacan Rosales on 24 October 2024. In the message, Los Chapitos Gang claims to have an alliance with the military against Los Mayitos. This event is related to a similar clash reported in Carboneras community in the same municipality (coded separately). During both clashes, a total of 19 people were killed.19 fatalities split across two clashes, 10 fatalities coded in this event.

notes: On 17 October 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, two armed individuals on a motorbike shot and killed a woman lawyer who was driving a van on Viaducto Miguel Aleman, near Parque Delta shopping mall and the intersection with Cuauhtemoc avenue, in Colonia Roma (drive-by). A version indicates that the perpetrators were following the victim since she left a bank. Police officers later found the motorbike used by the perpetrators in Colonia Obrera. The victim had previously been threatened by an officer of the Mexico City Attorney General's Office due to personal disputes. The suspected accomplices of the perpetrators, a man and two women, were arrested in Colonia Doctores, Cuauhtemoc, on 25 October 2024. One of the perpetrators was arrested in Colonia Obrera, Cuauhtemoc, on 13 December 2024. Another perpetrator (a man) and a woman who suspectedly planned the attack were arrested on 13 May 2025. 1 fatality.

notes: On 18 October 2024, in Altar, Sonora, according to witnesses, armed individuals on a vehicle shot at a vehicle on Caborca-Altar road, killing an American man (drive-by). One of the perpetrators, a suspected member of Los Deltas armed cell of Los Mayitos Gang, was arrested in Altar on 30 October 2024. Another perpetrator was killed during an armed clash with security forces in Altar around 30 October 2024 (coded separately). A third perpetrator was arrested in Altar on 13 February 2025. 1 fatality.

notes: On 20 October 2024, in San Cristobal de las Casas, Chiapas, according to witnesses, between two and four masked armed individuals on motorbikes shot and killed a man inside a van in the intersection of Las Peras and Franz Bloom streets, in the neighborhood of Cuxtitali (drive-by). The victim was a Tzotzil Indigenous (Mayan Indigenous group) catholic priest and human rights activist who had just officiated a mass at the church of Cuxtitali and was heading to the church of Guadalupe. The victim was known for denouncing the presence of criminal groups in Chiapas and participating in negotiations to solve conflicts between Indigenous communities and criminal groups. In 2021, the victim supported and mediated with the government for the formation of El Machete Policia Comunitaria in Pantelho. The same year, he was accused of being linked to the abduction of 21 men in Pantelho. According to some versions, the victim had been previously threatened by politicians connected to organized crime in the municipality of Simojovel, where the victim practiced as a priest. Additional versions indicate that the perpetrators of this attack could be members of Los Motonetos Gang or Los Herreras Gang. 1 fatality.

On 26 October 2024, in San Pedro, Sinaloa, unknown armed individuals attacked municipal police officers killing two police officers and injuring two while they were on surveillance. 2 fatalities, 2 injuries.

Around 29 October 2024 (as reported), near Carrizalejo, Sinaloa, two men were killed and their bodies were found with gunshot wounds, signs of torture, and covered by a canvas on a path that connects the road to Sanalona and La Grunidora village, a few meters from the bridge on Del Toro river. 2 fatalities.

Around 30 October 2024 (as reported), in Altar, Sonora, two armed men on a vehicle shot at municipal police officers on Obregon street. The officers fired back and killed the two men. One of them, an Honduran citizen, was a deserter from the Presidential Honor Guard of Honduras who was also a member of Los Delta Gang (allied of Los Mayitos Gang) and was one of the perpetrators of the killing of an American citizen in Altar on 18 October 2024 (coded separately). 2 fatalities.

notes: Around 6 November 2024 (as reported), in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, 11 people (two women and nine men, four of them minors) were killed and their dismembered bodies were found inside a van on Vicente Guerrero boulevard, on km. 272 of Del Sol highway, by Parador del Marques. The victims have been identified as part of the 17 vendors from Chautipan that disappeared in the villages of El Epazote (municipality of Chilapa de Alvarez) and Tlanicuilulco (municipality of Quechultenango) between 21-27 October 2024 (uncoded). On 4 November 2024, one of the minors appeared in a video on social media with the hands tied and saying that Los Jaleacos Gang had sent him to register the movements of Los Ardillos Gang. According to the military, members of Los Ardillos Gang abducted the victims and perpetrated this attack. 11 fatalities.

notes: On 9 November 2024, in Santiago de Queretaro, Queretaro, according to witnesses, four suspected members of the Santa Rosa de Lima Cartel entered Los Cantaritos bar on Circunvalacion avenue, in Colonia San Javier, and shot and killed 10 people (seven men and three women). 13 other people were injured. According to security authorities, the attack targeted one of the killed men, who was the leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) in Queretaro. He led a cell dedicated to the theft of fuel (huachicol) and was engaged in a territorial dispute with the Santa Rosa de Lima Cartel. A suspect was arrested the same day in the town of La Piedad, in the municipality of El Marques; three other suspects were arrested on 19 November 2024 in unspecified locations; two other were arrested on 21 November 2024 in the municipalities of Queretaro and Corregidora; and another was arrested in Queretaro around 22 August 2025. 10 fatalities, 13 injured.

notes: Around 8 October 2024 (as reported), in Poza Rica de Hidalgo, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, state police officers chased and clashed with unidentified individuals in Colonia Chapultepec, Fraccionamiento San Roman. A patrol vehicle collided with a van and a house during the chase. Three women (including an underage girl) and the passengers of the van were slightly injured. At least four injured.
On 15 October 2024, in Atotonilco de Tula, Hidalgo, three men shot and killed a man outside an Oxxo store in Colonia Senderos and then fled the scene. 1 fatality.

Around 27 October 2024 (as reported), in Eldorado, Sinaloa, a man and a woman were killed and their bodies were found inside a room that is believed to be used for the sale of drugs in El Realito. 2 fatalities.

On 10 October 2024, in Eldorado, Sinaloa, a 70-year-old man was killed after a grenade exploded on the Las Arenitas highway. The victim moved some sacks that blocked the passage along the aforementioned highway and underneath one of these there was a grenade placed that was activated with the movement. 1 fatality.

On 15 October 2024, in Ayutla de los Libres, Guerrero, an armed clash was reported between members of the UPOEG and another group, which is linked to the presence of a new group in the region. At least three people were killed, including the leader of the UPOEG. 3 fatalities.
Around 15 October 2024 (as reported), in Ayutla de los Libres, Guerrero, one person was killed and the human remains were found inside a plastic bag. 1 fatality.

On 23 October 2024, in Eldorado, Sinaloa, armed individuals engaged in an armed clash on the Culiacan-Eldorado highway close to Mezquitillo and the road was blocked with trucks that were later removed. One house and three vehicles were damaged. There were no casualties.

Around 19 October 2024 (as reported), in Apaxco de Ocampo, Mexico, a man was killed and his body was found with gunshot wounds and a threatening message in a field in Colonia Perez de Galeana. 1 fatality.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 7 November 2024, in La Joya, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, four armed men got off a vehicle and abducted a man on Gladiolas street. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.
Around 11 November 2024 (as reported), in Las Piedritas, Sinaloa, a man was killed and his body was found with the hands tied and gunshot wounds on a side of a hydraulic channel. 1 fatality.

On 17 November 2024, in Eldorado, Sinaloa, armed individuals opened fire at elements of the military who repelled the aggression and arrested one individual and seized weapons, magazines, cartridges, vests, vehicles and drugs. There were no injuries.

On 3 December 2024, in El Sauzal, Baja California, a businessman in the fishing industry was shot and killed by unidentified armed individuals. The victim was a member of the National Chamber of the Fishing and Aquaculture Industry (CANAINPESCA). 1 fatality.
Around 3 December 2024 (as reported), in Eldorado, Sinaloa, a man was killed and the body was found with a message. 1 fatality.

On 10 December 2024, in Ayutla de los Libres, Guerrero, armed rival groups engaged in an armed clash in Colonia Reforma. One civilian woman was killed as a result and one armed man died. 2 fatalities.

Around 12 December 2024 (as reported), in Ayutla de los Libres, Guerrero, armed individuals entered a house and shot at the people who were inside. These fired back, initiating a clash that resulted in two dead and several injured. 2 fatalities, several injured.

Around 17 October 2024 (between 17 - 18 October), in La Carroza, Nuevo Leon, a man was killed and his body was found partially burned on 18 October 2024. At least three individuals had abducted the victim from his house in San Jose de la Popa on 17 October 2024. The perpetrators also burned his house. 1 fatality.
Around 21 September 2024 (as reported), in Villanueva, Zacatecas, two people were killed and their bodies were found dismembered inside plastic bags. 2 fatalities.
Around 22 September 2024 (as reported), in Villanueva, Zacatecas, a man was killed and his body was found in Colonia Flores del Pedregal in a vacant lot covered in a sheet. 1 fatality.

Around 23 September 2024 (month of), near Higueras de Abuya, Sinaloa, a man was killed and his body was found with his hands tied to his back on the Culiacan-Mazatlan highway. The body was in a state of decomposition. 1 fatality.

Around 27 September 2024 (as reported), in Higueras de Abuya, Sinaloa, armed groups clashed. The event is likely related to the ongoing fight between the Sinaloa Cartel factions in the municipality of Culiacan that started on 9 September (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

Around 3 October 2024 (as reported), in Cerro Gordo, Guanajuato, a man and a woman were killed and their bodies were found dismembered accompanied by two messages on banners at the central plaza. This attack is likely related to a series of attack perpetrated by the Santa Rosa de Lima Cartel. 2 fatalities.

Around 3 October 2024 (as reported), in Valtierrilla, Guanajuato, a man and a woman were killed and their bodies were found at the entrance to the community tied and with messages next to their bodies. This attack is likely related to a series of attack perpetrated by the Santa Rosa de Lima Cartel. 2 fatalities.

On 2 October 2024, in Apetatitlan, Tlaxcala, two armed individuals shot at a businessman of the oil industry in Colonia Tecolotla. The businessman died as a result and his driver was injured. 1 fatality, 1 injury.

Around 3 October 2024 (as reported), in Higueras de Abuya, Sinaloa, a man was killed and his body was found with signs of torture and tied with a rope around his neck close to El Ejido Abuya Ceuta 2. The man's hands were tied to his back and he was naked from his torso up. 1 fatality.

source: El Siglo de Durango; El Sol de Sinaloa; Noroeste; Riodoce; Tabasco Hoy
notes: On 28 September 2024, in Higueras de Abuya, Sinaloa, rival armed groups clashed on the highway known as 'Maxipista Culiacan-Mazatla'. Several other related clashes were recorded on the same day in other communities along this road (coded separately). This event is likely related to the ongoing fight between factions of the Sinaloa Cartel that started on 9 September (coded separately). There were no casualties.

source: El Sol de Sinaloa; La Prensa de Monclova; Milenio; Riodoce
notes: On 20 October 2024, in Higueras de Abuya, Sinaloa, army officers and armed individuals clashed. An officer died and several were injured. This event is suspectedly linked to an armed clash that took place in Los Tanques the same day (coded separately), and is likely part of the war between 'Los Chapitos' and 'Los Mayitos' factions of the Sinaloa Cartel. 1 fatality.

On 25 October 2024, near Santo Tomas Chautla, Puebla, armed individuals in two vehicles shot and injured a woman traveling in her truck to Valsequillo (drive-by). The perpetrators fled the scene. 1 injury.

On 2 November 2024, in Villanueva, Zacatecas, gang members travelling in several vehicles attacked at the state police during a police operation. The police officers from the Zacatecas Immediate Reaction Forces (FRIZ) repelled the attack. The regional director of security operations in the municipality was killed along with an armed man. Also four police officers were injured. The armed men also launched tire-puncturing devices. 2 fatalities.

Around 9 November 2024 (as reported), in Villanueva, Zacatecas, members of an unidentified criminal organization abducted a man, tortured him, and shot and killed him. The body was found on a path leading to the community of La Encarnacion. 1 fatality.

On 24 October 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, two armed individuals traveling on a motorcycle attacked two men at the Monterrey park in the north of the city in Colonia Fomerrey 15. One man died and another was injured. 1 fatality, 1 injury.
On 20 September 2024, in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, armed individuals opened fire from a motorcycle and killed a man at a car wash while he was working (drive-by). 1 fatality.
On 15 September 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, according to witnesses, armed men shot and killed a man in Colonia Independencia. 1 fatality.

On 15 September 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, a man was shot and killed by unidentified armed individuals in Colonia Benito Juarez. The event was near a house known as a drug dealing place. 1 fatality.

source: El Siglo de Durango; La Verdad
notes: On 16 September 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, two armed individuals got off a van and entered a house in the intersection of Damian Carmona and Privada Carmona in Colonia Urdiales, where they shot at people who were celebrating a party, killing three people and injuring seven, including two minors. 3 fatalities.

Around 16 September 2024 (as reported), in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, a man was killed and his body was left by two men in front of a house in the intersection of Sendero de la Colina 410 and San Bernardo streets, in Colonia Colinas Residencial. The body had signs of torture, gunshot wounds and a threatening message written on a cardboard. According to witnesses, the two men fled in a car driven by a third person and escorted by more individuals in a van. 1 fatality.
Around 20 September 2024 (as reported), in El Cedro, Tabasco, a man was killed and his body was found on the banks of the Carrizal river. The victim was suspected to be tied. 1 fatality.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 18 September 2024, in Coatzacoalcos, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, a couple of armed individuals on a motorcycle intercepted and shot at the CTM delegate in Colonia Emiliano Zapata. The delegate was transported to the hospital. 1 injury.

On 22 September 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, three armed men shot at a Christian preacher after a church service in Colonia Argentina in a warehouse. The man died as a result and his wife was injured. The victim is considered a former member of Los Zetas. 1 fatality, 1 injury.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 23 September 2024, in Coatzacoalcos, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, a couple of armed men opened fire at two mechanics at a car shop in Colonia Manantiales and killed both. 2 fatalities.

notes: On 27 September 2024, in Coatzacoalcos, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, according to witnesses, two armed individuals got on public bus 126 on Universidad Veracruzana avenue, in Colonia El Tesoro, and shot and killed a man. 1 fatality.
Around 29 September 2024 (weekend of), in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, according to the police, two armed men shot at a couple in Colonia Sarabia. One woman was killed and a man was injured. 1 fatality.
Around 3 October 2024 (as reported), in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, two men were killed and his body was found with signs of torture and gunshot wounds on the Culiacan-ElDorado highway. 2 fatalities.
On 30 September 2024, in Michimaloya, Hidalgo, according to witnesses, armed men in two vehicles shot at two people. One person was killed and another one was injured. 1 fatality.

On 2 October 2024, in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, two armed individuals arrived at a home on a motorcycle and one individual shot and killed a man in Colonia Josefa Zozaya. The home was known as a point for the sale of drugs. 1 fatality.

On 3 October 2024, in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, armed individuals in two vehicles chased and shot at a couple of men in their vehicle (drive-by) causing the driver to lose control and crash. Both men were injured as a result. 2 injuries.

source: El Siglo de Durango; El Sol de Sinaloa; Noroeste; Riodoce; Tabasco Hoy
notes: On 28 September 2024, in Pueblos Unidos, Sinaloa, rival armed groups clashed on the highway known as 'Maxipista Culiacan-Mazatla'. Several other related clashes were recorded on the same day in other communities along this road (coded separately). This event is likely related to the ongoing fight between factions of the Sinaloa Cartel that started on 9 September (coded separately). There were no casualties.
Around 5 October 2024 (as reported), in Tula de Allende, Hidalgo, a man was killed and his body was found with signs of violence in Colonia El Llano Primera Seccion with his hands tied. 1 fatality.

On 6 October 2024, in the municipality of Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, armed men intercepted a mother and her daughter close to the highway to the airport, one man got out and opened fire at both women and then fled the scene in front of fraccionamiento Accadia. Both women were injured. 2 injuries.
Around 5 October 2024 (as reported), in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, a man was killed and his dismembered body was found between Colonia Rincon de la Primavera and Ladrillera. 1 fatality.
On 5 October 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, two armed men opened fire at a group of people in Colonia Industrial killing two and injuring two outside a mechanic's shop. 2 fatalities, 2 injuries.
On 9 October 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, armed individuals from a criminal group shot at state police officers in Colonia Industrial. The police repelled the attack. There were no casualties.

On 9 October 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in Colonia Bernabe. It is suspected that the event is related to a settling of accounts for drug problems, however, this was not confirmed by the authorities. 1 fatality.

On 11 October 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a municipal transit police officer outside a house in colonia Barrio Alameda. The victim was on leave (off-duty). 1 fatality.

Around 10 October 2024 (as reported), in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, a man was killed and his body was found with gunshot wounds inside a house in fraccionamiento Bernardo Reyes. The house was known to be a drug dealing place. 1 fatality.

On 11 October 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, according to witnesses, an armed man shot and killed a man in Colonia Bernabe. The perpetrator ran away with his accomplice that was waiting for him. 1 fatality.
On 17 October 2024, near Ejido Canan, Sinaloa, military and state police officers clashed with armed individuals. Casualties unknown.

source: 24 Horas (Mexico); El Sol de Sinaloa; Riodoce
notes: On 17 October 2024, in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, army officers and armed individuals clashed in the intersection of Culiacan-Eldorado and La 20 roads. The officers seized a fireweapon and homemade explosive devices, which were defused. This event is likely part of the war between 'Los Chapitos' and 'Los Mayitos' factions of the Sinaloa Cartel. Casualties unknown.

On 17 October 2024, near Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, state and municipal police officers clashed with suspected members of the Cartel del Noreste (CDN) along kms. 195 and 200 of Carretera Nacional. The cartel members threw 'ponchallantas' (objects to puncture tires), abandoned two vehicles, and fled in different directions. A stray bullet collaterally injured a trailer driver, who was transferred to a hospital. This event is part of three clashes between authorities and the CDN that took place in Nuevo Leon the same day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 17 October 2024, in Pueblos Unidos, Sinaloa, armed groups clashed. This event is likely part of the war between 'Los Chapitos' and 'Los Mayitos' factions of the Sinaloa Cartel. Casualties unknown.

On 12 October 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, two armed individuals arrived on a motorcycle and opened fire at two 17 year old men outside their home in Colonia Tierra y Libertad. Both were wounded as a result. 2 injuries.

source: El Sol de Sinaloa; La Silla Rota
notes: Around 14 October 2024 (as reported), in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, two people were killed and their bodies were found with signs of torture and wrapped in bags and blankets on the side of the Eldorado highway. 2 fatalities.

Around 14 October 2024 (as reported), close to Ejido Canan, Sinaloa, two people were killed and their bodies were found wrapped in plastic bags on the highway Culiacan-Eldorado at the height of the Faculty of Agronomy of the Autonomous University of Sinaloa (UAS). 2 fatalities.

Around 15 October 2024 (as reported), in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, a man was killed and his body was found with signs of torture and with his hands tied and his face covered in tape in La Bascula. 1 fatality.

On 18 October 2024, in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, according to witnesses, two armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed a man who was also driving a motorcycle on Laguna Madre and Isla Revillagigedo streets, in Colonia Valle de Guadalupe (drive-by). 1 fatality.

On 21 October 2024, in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between military officers and armed individuals (likely affiliated with the Sinaloa Cartel). This event is related to similar clashes involving factions of the Sinaloa Cartel recorded in other locations of this state (coded separately). There were no casualties.
On 18 October 2024, in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, according to witnesses, armed individuals shot and killed a man inside a house on Puebla y Monterrey street, in Colonia Josefa Zozaya. 1 fatality.
Around 21 October 2024 (as reported), in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, a man was killed and his body was found with signs of torture in Colonia La huerta. 1 fatality.
Around 25 October 2024 (as reported), in Los Aparicio, Zacatecas, a person was killed and the body was found with signs of torture and gunshot wounds. 1 fatality.

Around 21 October 2024 (as reported), in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, an unknown number of people were killed and the human remains were found in at least five point in the city including Colonia Industrial. According to local sources, a female torso, a female head, a body without limbs, two arms, a male torso, two upper limbs, a male head and a left leg have been found. The remaining would belong to at least one man and one woman. At least 2 fatalities.

On 21 October 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, an armed man shot and killed two young men who were sitting in front of a house known as a drug dealing point in Colonia Hogares Ferrocarrileros. 2 fatalities.
Around 22 October 2024 (as reported), in Ejido El Quemadito, Sinaloa, a person was killed and the body was found dismembered and signs of torture. 1 fatality.
Around 22 October 2024 (month of), in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, a man was killed and the body was found in an advanced state of decomposition and burned. 1 fatality.

Around 25 October 2024 (as reported), in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, four men were killed and their bodies were found with their hands tied, signs of torture, and gunshot wounds on the Culiacan-Eldorado highway on the road to Campo Victoria. 4 fatalities.

Around 26 October 2024 (as reported), in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, two men were killed and their bodies were found with signs of torture and with their hands and feet tied and faces covered with tape at the junction of the Culiacan-Eldorado highway with La 20. 2 fatalities.
Around 27 October 2024 (as reported), in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, a person was killed and the body was found wrapped in plastic on the highway 19. 1 fatality.

On 30 October 2024, near Tula de Allende, Hidalgo, state and municipal police officers and armed huachicoleros (oil thieves) who drove three vehicles clashed along the Tula-Tlahuelilpan road, when officers tried to stop a tanker that suspectedly carried stolen oil. No officers were injured. It is unknown whether there were casualties among the huachicoleros. A huachicolero was arrested. Casualties unknown.

On 30 October 2024, in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, two armed men on a motorbike shot and killed a man that was driving a motorbike in the intersection of Del Amanecer and Rio Bravo streets, in Colonia Valle del Sol (drive-by). 1 fatality.
On 1 November 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, two armed men shot and killed a man in Colonia Valle de San Martin. 1 fatality.

On 3 November 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, according to witnesses, armed men travelling in two motorcycles shot at a house in colonia Riveras del Rio. A woman was killed, a minor and a man were injured. The house is known as a drug dealing point. 1 fatality, 2 injured.
On 3 November 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, according to witnesses, armed men on a motorcycle shot at a man in a vehicle in a drive-by in colonia Fomerrey 112. The victim was killed. 1 fatality.

source: 24 Horas (Mexico); El Blog del Narco; El Sol de Sinaloa; Riodoce
notes: On 3 November 2024, in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between the military forces and armed men travelling in three vehicles on the Culiacan-Eldorado highway around the Cuba community. One person was injured and four people were arrested. One of the arrested was the former chief of security of the Sinaloa Cartel and current member of Los Mayitos Gang. 1 injured.

On 6 November 2024, in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, several armed individuals opened fire at municipal police officers which led to a chase and the crashing of a car in Colonia Arboledas del Oriente. There were no injuries and the armed individuals escaped the scene.

source: AFN - Tijuana; El Sol de Sinaloa
notes: Around 6 November 2024 (as reported), in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, two men were killed and their bodies were found with signs of torture, the hands tied to their backs, tape on the mouth, and gunshot wounds near an agricultural field known as 'Florencia'. One of the victims was a police officer at the office of the State Attorney General and also a member of the Sinaloa Cartel. He had requested a voluntary leave of absence from the police force to join the fighting between cartel factions in Culiacan. He had previously survived an attack in San Quintin on 9 June 2024 (coded separately). 2 fatalities.
On 13 November 2024, in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, two men entered a mechanic's workshop and killed two mechanics in Colonia Rafael Ramirez. 2 fatalities.

On 11 November 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, armed men traveling in five vehicles intercepted and kidnapped a man when he was driving in Colonia del Paseo Residencial. The man was found alive days later.
Around 15 November 2024 (as reported), in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, a man was killed and his body was found wrapped in plastic bags and a blanket inside a barrel in the city center. 1 fatality.

Around 9 November 2024 (as reported), in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, a man was killed and his body was found with gunshot wounds, tape on the mouth, and the hands and feet tied, under a bridge in the field on Nuevo Mexico. 1 fatality.
Around 9 November 2024 (as reported), in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, a man was killed and his body was found with signs of torture. 1 fatality.

Around 10 November 2024 (as reported), in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, two men were killed and their bodies were found with gunshot wounds and signs of torture in a field between a poultry processing plant and the path to El Quemadito, 100 meters from Culiacan-Eldorado road. One of them had the hands tied. 2 fatalities.

source: El Sol de Sinaloa; El Universal (Mexico); Riodoce
notes: Around 11 November 2024 (as reported), in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, two men were killed and their bodies were found with gunshot wounds, signs of torture, and a cardboard with unspecified messages in the junction of Culiacan-Eldorado road and the path to Lazareto. One of the victims had been abducted by armed men hours earlier. 2 fatalities.
Around 13 November 2024 (as reported), in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, a man was killed and the body was found with a message. 1 fatality.

source: 24 Horas (Mexico); Borderland Beat; El Norte; El Sol de Sinaloa; Entorno Informativo; La Prensa de Monclova; La Silla Rota; La Verdad; Noroeste; Riodoce; SDP Noticias; Zeta Tijuana
notes: Around 26 November 2024 (as reported), near Ejido Canan, Sinaloa, six men were killed and their bodies were found with gunshot wounds and signs of torture in front of the Faculty of Agronomy of the Autonomous University of Sinaloa (UAS) on Culiacan-Eldorado road. Three of the bodies were semi-naked, some had the hands tied with ropes, and at least one had the head covered with a plastic bag. All the victims had been abducted in the municipality of Navolato in the previous days. The victims were identified as members of Los Mayitos Gang. The perpetrators were members of Los Chapitos Gang. A video was recorded when the victims were interrogated and at least of them were killed during the recording. The video was shared on social media. 6 fatalities.

source: El Sol de Sinaloa; Noroeste; Riodoce
notes: Around 28 November 2024 (as reported), in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, a man was killed and his body was found wrapped in plastics and tied up. The victim was a municipal police officer who was a bodyguard of the director. The victim had been previously kidnapped in Quila. 1 fatality.

Relatives of the victim were abducted in Culiacan Rosales on 13 December 2024 (coded separately). 1 fatality.

Around 8 October 2024 (as reported), in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, a man was killed and his dismembered body was found inside three plastic bags on Juventino Rosas street, in Colonia Nuevo Repueblo. 1 fatality.
On 4 October 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Milpa Alta, members of Los Estupidos Gang killed a man in colonia San Pablo Oztotepec. The perpetrators were arrested around 9 June 2025. 1 fatality.

Around 20 October 2024 (as reported), in Navolato, Sinaloa, a man was admitted to a hospital with signs of violence and handcuffs on 27 October. The victim reported that he was kidnapped 7 days earlier. 1 injury.

There were no casualties.

On 14 September 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, armed individuals in a vehicle shot and killed a man in the intersection of Reforma Agraria and Zarzal de Medina streets, in Colonia Ampliacion Medina (drive-by). Also in Leon de los Aldama, armed individuals on a motorbike shot and killed a man in the intersection of Selva Rosada and Selva Confusa streets, in Colonia Lomas de la Selva (drive-by). 2 fatalities.

On 17 September 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, two armed individuals entered a store in the intersection of Brisa de Braga and Brisa de Sintra, in Colonia Brisas del Campestre, and shot and killed a man who was playing with a slot machine. 1 fatality.

Around 17 September 2024 (as reported), near Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, a man was killed and his body was found wrapped in a blanket on a path leading to the community of Ojo de Agua. 1 fatality.

On 17 September 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, armed individuals on a motorbike shot and killed a man on Antonio Martinez Aguayo, in Colonia Sinarquistas, bordering Colonia Canada Real (drive-by). 1 fatality.

On 18 September 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, two men got out of a car and opened fire at two men and one woman in Colonia Parques de San Juan and then fled the scene with several armed men. Both men died and the woman was injured. 2 fatalities, 1 injury.

On 19 September 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, one armed man opened fire at a couple and their daughter who attempted to flee the scene in Colonia Villas de San Juan. The armed man fled the scene on a motorcycle with an accomplice. The 13 year old girl died as a result. 1 fatality.

On 19 September 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed the local Chief of Mobility Inspection and Vigilance while he was riding in his car between Colonia Los Pinos y Fracciones Hacienda La Pompa. 1 fatality.

On 19 September 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, armed men in a vehicle and a truck opened fire from the vehicles at a man walking on the street in Colonia Villas de Nuestra Senora de la Luz (drive-by). 1 fatality.

On 20 September 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, one armed individual opened fire at a man in Colonia La Selva and then fled the scene with an accomplice. The victim died as a result. 1 fatality.

On 20 September 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, three men kidnapped a woman in Colonia Canada del Refugio. Police officers intervened at the exit to Lagos de Moreno and arrested the three men and released the kidnapped woman.

source: El Siglo de Durango; El Sol de Sinaloa
notes: Around 14 September 2024 (as reported), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, a man was killed and only the head was found. It is suspected that the victim had been kidnapped a day before in Colonia Simon Bolivar around Parque Culiacan 87, however, this was not confirmed. In another event, a man was killed and his body was found beheaded in sector Las Estancias. The event is likely related to the ongoing fight between the Sinaloa Cartel factions of Los Mayitos and Los Chapitos gangs in the municipality of Culiacan that started on 9 September (coded separately). 2 fatalities.

On 14 September 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, according to residents, there was an armed clash between members of criminal groups in Ciudad Universitaria, Las Quintas and the exit to Imala. Also unidentified men set a (narco) roadblock with tire flatteners. Casualties unknown. The event is likely related to the ongoing fight between the Sinaloa Cartel factions of Los Mayitos and Los Chapitos gangs in the municipality of Culiacan that started on 9 September (coded separately).

Around 15 September 2024 (as reported), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, members of Los Mayitos Gang held and killed a member of Los Chapitos gang. The event was recorded in video and shared on social media. 1 fatality.

source: El Sol de Sinaloa; El Universal (Mexico)
notes: On 15 September 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, several armed men entered a house and shot and killed a woman on Manuel Carpio avenue, in Colonia Miguel Hidalgo. Another three men were abducted. The victim's whereabouts are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 15 September 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, unidentified individuals shot at a house in Fraccionamiento Colinas del Bosque (likely with people inside since according to witnesses a person was heard calling for help, although it is not known if that person was injured or kidnapped). More than 100 shell casings were collected after the event. Casualties unknown.

source: El Siglo de Durango; El Sol de Sinaloa
notes: Around 15 September 2024 (as reported), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, a man was killed and his body was found with gunshot wounds with his hands and feet tied up in Colonia Miguel Hidalgo. 1 fatality.

Around 15 September 2024 (month of), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, a man was killed and his body was found with gunshot wounds with his hands and feet tied up in Bacurimi in an advanced state of decomposition. 1 fatality.

Around 15 September 2024 (as reported), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, a man was killed and his body was found with gunshot wounds and the hands and feet tied on Mina Purisima street, in Colonia Miguel Hidalgo. Also in Culiacan Rosales, three people were killed and their bodies were found with signs of torture. These events are likely related to the ongoing fight between the Sinaloa Cartel factions of Los Mayitos and Los Chapitos gangs in the municipality of Culiacan that started on 9 September (coded separately). 4 fatalities.

On 16 September 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, armed individuals abducted three men that were in a car on Islas Ciclidas street, between Mar de Tasmania and Mar de Coral streets, in Colonia Prados del Sur. One of the victims, the son of a well-known local journalist, was released hours later. The whereabouts of the other two victims are unknown.

source: Diario de Morelos; El Blog del Narco; El Siglo de Durango; El Sol de Sinaloa; La Jornada; Metro Mx; Riodoce
notes: Around 16 September 2024 (as reported), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, a man was killed and his semi-stripped body was found with gunshot wounds and his head wrapped in a plastic bag in the intersection of Libramiento Benito Juarez La Costerita and Paseo de los Balcanes, in Fraccionamiento Villa Bonita, close to an ice store. Also in Culiacan Rosales, five men were killed and their bodies were found wearing hats and with the hands tied on a bench in front of Splash Club on Mexico 15 road, by a path leading to a CFE substation. These events are likely related to the ongoing fight between the Sinaloa Cartel factions of Los Mayitos and Los Chapitos gangs in the municipality of Culiacan that started on 9 September (coded separately). 6 fatalities.

source: El Proceso; El Sol de Sinaloa; La Verdad; Noroeste; Riodoce; Tabasco Hoy
notes: On 16 September 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, armed individuals ambushed a military convoy that was patrolling on Los Alamos and De los Sabinos boulevards in Colonia La Campina, initiating a clash that resulted in an officer dead, another injured, two individuals injured, and three arrested. According to witnesses, the clash initiated close to the local park and Cobaes school and extended along Sabinos street, Colonia Miguel Hidalgo and north of Ciudad Universitaria. Also in Culiacan Rosales, irons ('ponchallantas') were set on the bridge connecting Las Quintas and Isla Musala in Colonia La Campina and on Rolando Arjona and Emiliano Zapata boulevards, including on the bridge known as 'Pepsi's bridge' (likely used to set (narco) roadblocks). These events are likely related to the ongoing fight between the Sinaloa Cartel factions of Los Mayitos and Los Chapitos gangs in the municipality of Culiacan that started on 9 September (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 17 September 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, two armed men entered a clothing store on Constituyente Francisco Mojica Novena street, by De los Constituyentes avenue, in Colonia Industrial El Palmito, and shot and injured woman who owns the store. The perpetrators fled in a vehicle.

Around 17 September 2024 (as reported), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, two men were killed and their bodies were found wrapped in blankets on Chichichanqui street, between Miguel Hidalgo and Tlolotepec streets, in Colonia Ampliacion El Barro, one street away from the road leading to Sanalona. There were toy cars and a plastic yellow tray over their bodies. This event is likely related to the ongoing fight between the Sinaloa Cartel factions of Los Mayitos and Los Chapitos gangs in the municipality of Culiacan that started on 9 September (coded separately). 2 fatalities.
On 18 September 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, several armed individuals kidnapped a person in Colonia 22 de diciembre. The whereabouts of the kidnapped individual remain unknown.

source: El Blog del Narco; La Jornada; Milenio; Riodoce; Tabasco Hoy
notes: Around 18 September 2024 (as reported), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, three men were killed and their bodies were found underneath a bridge on La Costerita. Two were decapitated and the men's hands were tied with tape. All three men were reported as missing. The same day, a woman was killed and her body was found in Colonia El Barrio with his hands tied, wrapped in a blanket and with bullet wounds. The bodies bore signs of torture. 4 fatalities.

Around 19 September 2024 (as reported), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, a woman was killed by suspected members of Los Mayitos and her body was found with a frog in her mouth and a walkie talkie next to her. The walkie-talkie is suspected to mean the woman is the eyes and ears for the Los Chapos and the frog is suspected to mean she is a traitor. The event is likely related to the ongoing fight between the Sinaloa Cartel factions of Los Mayitos and Los Chapitos gangs in the municipality of Culiacan that started on 9 September. 1 fatality.

Around 19 September 2024 (between 18 September - 19 September), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, a man was killed and his body was found with signs of torture and wrapped in a blanket in Colonia La Costera. The man was kidnapped on 18 September. 1 fatality.
Around 20 September 2024 (as reported), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, a man was killed and his body was found wrapped in plastic in Colonia 22 de diciembre.

Around 20 September 2024 (as reported), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, two men were killed and their bodies were found with gunshot wounds, signs of torture and with their hands tied. One of the victims had a bag over his head on the side of the Mexico 15 international highway. It is suspected that the victims were brothers. 2 fatalities.

Around 21 September 2024 (as reported), in Marroquin, Guanajuato, the former candidate for mayor of Apaseo el Alto from the Green Ecologist Party of Mexico was killed and his body was found on a dirt road that leads to the community of Marroquin. It is suspected that the politician had been kidnapped before. The victim was found with signs of violence and bullet wounds. The victim was a treasurer in two administrations of the Apaseo el Alto government. He also worked as campaign coordinator for a Morena's candidate for mayor, who was killed in the 2018 election. 1 fatality.

source: El Blog del Narco; El Sol de Sinaloa; La Jornada; Riodoce
notes: On 21 September 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash among municipal police and military officers against armed individuals during a police patrol around Desarrollo Urbano Tres Rios. Three armed men were killed, including a leader of Los Chapitos gang. Two were arrested and two military officers were injured. 3 fatalities.

source: Borderland Beat; El Siglo de Durango; El Sol de Sinaloa; La Jornada; Riodoce
notes: Around 21 September 2024 (as reported), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, five men were killed and their bodies were found with their hands tied up and with hats on the exit of the highway 15. In another event, a man was killed and the body was found with signs of torture and the hands tied up to the back around La Costerita. 6 fatalities.

On 22 September 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, armed individuals entered a house and killed two young men in Colonia Nuevo Leon. The perpetrators set fire to the door and window of the house. 2 fatalities.

On 22 September 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, armed individuals kidnapped a man who was intercepted by them in the south part of the city. The gunmen also placed objects to damage tires on the road. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

On 24 September 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, armed individuals on a motorcycle chased and shot at a taxi driver traveling in a taxi with his family on the Jose Maria Morelos highway (drive-by). The driver's son died as a result and he and his wife were injured. 1 fatality, 2 injuries.

On 24 September 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, four men on two motorcycles interrupted a wake for a nine-year-old girl who was killed the week before and opened fire at the attendees, killing one man and injuring five on Villas de San Juan boulevard. 1 fatality, 4 injuries.

On 24 September 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, armed men intercepted a woman public servant from the Municipal Sewerage and Potable Water Board (JAPAC) and kidnapped her. This attack is likely related to a wave of violence triggered by clashes between factions of the Sinaloa Cartel which started on 9 September (coded separately). The whereabouts remain unknown.

On 24 September 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, unknown armed individuals opened fire at the facade of a home in Colonia Guadalupe Victoria. There was a woman inside the house. This attack is likely related to a wave of violence triggered by clashes between factions of the Sinaloa Cartel which started on 9 September (coded separately). There were no injuries.

Around 24 September 2024 (as reported), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, a man was killed and his body was found with signs of torture on the free highway south of Barrancas. This attack is likely related to a wave of violence triggered by clashes between factions of the Sinaloa Cartel which started on 9 September (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 25 September 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, according to witnesses, armed individuals forcefully entered a home and shot a man several times and injured him in Colonia Santa Clara. The same day in Leon, one armed individual got out of a car and shot at a woman and a man in Colonia San Miguel and then fled the scene with several other individuals. Both were injured as a result. 3 injuries.

On 25 September 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, two armed men opened fire from a moving motorcycle at two men outside a home in Colonia Observatorio (drive-by). One man died as a result and the other was injured. 1 fatality, 1 injury.

Around 25 September 2024 (as reported), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, two people were killed and their bodies were found with signs of torture and with their hands tied on the international highway 15 La Costerita. This attack is likely related to a wave of violence triggered by clashes between factions of the Sinaloa Cartel which started on 9 September (coded separately). 2 fatalities.

source: El Sol de Sinaloa; Noroeste; Riodoce
notes: On 25 September 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, armed individuals shot and killed three people and injured a man. The injured man sought help from a military convoy and guided the officers to the location of the bodies, which were semi-buried in a path by the bridge that connects Libramiento Benito Juarez La Costerita and Benjamin Hill avenue in sector Barrancos, on the back of a factory of diary products.
